item.title: 普拉博沃寻求让一美元午餐计划实现 8%增长的模式
item.description: 当选总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）希望他的免费校餐能释放印尼的增长潜力。两个走过同样道路的亚洲大国为该项目提供了成功的经验和教训，同时也是一个警示故事。【原文：President-elect Prabowo Subianto is hoping his free school meals can unlock Indonesia’s growth potential. Two large Asian countries who’ve tread the same path offer lessons for the project’s success — and also serve as cautionary tales.】

item.title: 进入日本央行和美联储周，亚洲股市早盘上涨：市场综述
item.description: 在本周日本、美国和英国央行的关键决策以及一些重要的科技财报发布之前，亚洲股市早盘有望上涨。美元和日元汇率持稳。【原文：Asian stocks are poised to rise in early trading ahead of a week of key central bank decisions in Japan, US and UK, as well as some big tech earnings releases. The dollar and yen were steady.】

item.title: 32 小时央行狂潮笼罩市场，交易员忧心忡忡
item.description: 在主要经济体发出相互矛盾的信号扰乱市场之后，投资者在本周伊始急于寻找有关全球货币政策近期路径问题的答案。【原文：Investors begin the week desperate for answers to questions about the near-term path of global monetary policy after conflicting signals from key economies upended markets.】

item.title: 富裕阶层的挥霍令日本零售业股票两极分化
item.description: 尽管面临通胀环境，日本的百货商店经营者仍受益于富裕购物者增加的消费，相比之下，低端零售商的表现则不尽如人意，因为人们在选择购买主食时变得更加挑剔。【原文：Japanese department store operators are benefiting from increased spending by wealthier shoppers despite the inflationary environment, in contrast to lower-end retailers which are underperforming as people become pickier in what staples they choose to buy.】

item.title: 澳大利亚制定严厉气候法规，企业陷入 "瘫痪
item.description: 澳大利亚计划引入严格的气候信息披露规则，这使企业更加关注世界上最大的人均排放国之一的合规问题。【原文：Australia’s plans to introduce stringent rules on climate disclosures are driving up concerns among businesses about compliance in one of the world’s biggest per-capita emitters.】

item.title: 里夫斯承诺 "修复 "英国经济基础
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）将在周一的演讲中承诺 "修复 "英国经济的 "根基"，并试图揭露她所继承的支出紧缩问题。【原文：UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves will promise in a speech on Monday to “fix the foundations” of the British economy as she seeks to expose the spending squeeze she inherited.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 全球最大石油和天然气生产商的财报季继续进行，雪佛龙公司和埃克森美孚公司将于周五结束报告期。美国最大的小麦种植州北达科他州的作物巡回展览为全球谷物供应带来了一些有希望的结果。世界在不断变暖。【原文：Earnings season continues for the world’s largest oil and gas producers, with Chevron Corp. and Exxon Mobil Corp. capping the reporting period on Friday. A crop tour in top US wheat-growing state North Dakota is yielding some promising results for global grain supplies. And the world just keeps getting warmer.】

item.title: 土耳其埃尔多安加剧反以色列言论，威胁进行干预
item.description: 土耳其总统雷杰普-塔伊普-埃尔多安（Recep Tayyip Erdogan）对以色列的言论不断升级，暗示土耳其可能会代表巴勒斯坦人进行干预，并可能提供军事支持，其方式与土耳其在其他冲突中的做法类似。【原文：Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is escalating his rhetoric against Israel, suggesting Turkey could intervene on behalf of Palestinians, possibly with military support, in ways similar to what it has done in other conflicts.】

item.title: 美联储落后了吗？债券交易员押注大幅降息以防万一
item.description: 债券交易员们已经为 9 月份开始的逐步降息做好了准备，他们正在加大边际赌注，以防美国经济突然下滑迫使美联储采取更加激进的行动。【原文：Bond traders who’ve set themselves up for gradual interest-rate cuts starting in September are ramping up side bets in case a sudden slide in the US economy forces the Federal Reserve to be even more aggressive.】

item.title: 澳大利亚加息辩论将因通胀数据而进入高潮
item.description: 随着本周季度通胀数据的公布，有关澳大利亚央行是否需要在后期收紧政策的争论很可能会得到解决，而澳大利亚货币也将被卷入其中。【原文：Debate over whether Australia’s central bank needs to deliver a late-cycle policy tightening is likely to be resolved with the release of quarterly inflation data this week — and the currency is set to be swept up in the fallout.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚称将根据经济改革计划实行货币浮动
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚总理阿比-艾哈迈德表示，作为正在进行的宏观经济改革的一部分，埃塞俄比亚计划浮动其货币比尔。【原文：Ethiopia plans to float its currency, the birr, as part of ongoing macroeconomic reforms, according to Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed.】

item.title: 澳大利亚的过量死亡揭示了 Covid 长而致命的尾巴
item.description: 澳大利亚人的死亡率仍然高于大流行之前，这反映出 Covid-19 的残余影响可能会导致全球死亡和疾病的持续增加。【原文：Australians are still dying at higher rates than before the pandemic, reflecting how Covid-19’s lingering effects may be driving a sustained increase in death and disease around the globe.】

item.title: 耶伦驳斥特朗普关于美元损害美国制造业的论点
item.description: 在美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普看来，强势美元正在重创美国制造商。对于美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）来说，事情并非如此简单。【原文：In former President Donald Trump’s view, a strong dollar is walloping US manufacturers. For Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, it’s just not that simple.】

item.title: 德国财政部长仍需为预算争取 80-90 亿欧元
item.description: 德国财政部长克里斯蒂安-林德纳（Christian Lindner）表示，德国政府仍需为明年的预算争取多达 90 亿欧元（98 亿美元）的资金，因为政府正在等待对一些拟议措施的审查结果。【原文：Germany’s government still has to secure as much as €9 billion ($9.8 billion) for next year’s budget as it awaits the outcome of a review of some proposed measures, according to Finance Minister Christian Lindner.】

item.title: 纳斯达克 100 指数濒临调整边缘，大型科技公司财报来袭
item.description: 纳斯达克 100 指数在两周多的时间里下跌了 8%，处于调整的边缘。纳斯达克 100 指数能否避开这一可疑的里程碑，将取决于四家总价值近 10 万亿美元的公司的盈利情况。【原文：The violent rotation out of Big Tech has dragged the Nasdaq 100 Index down 8% in just over two weeks, leaving it on the cusp of a correction. Whether it can avoid that dubious milestone will likely come down to earnings from a quartet of companies worth nearly $10 trillion combined.】

item.title: 风险最高的国家在美国大选动荡中脱颖而出，成为缓冲区
item.description: 世界上一些风险最大的国家的债务被认为能为新兴市场投资者提供保护，使其免受美国大选动荡的影响。【原文：Debt from some of the world’s riskiest nations is tipped to offer emerging-market investors protection against US election upheaval.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉人前往投票站检验对民主的承诺
item.description: 十多年来，委内瑞拉人第一次对获得民主机会充满希望。【原文：For the first time in more than a decade, Venezuelans are hopeful about getting a chance at democracy.】

item.title: 意大利总统梅洛尼誓言在金砖倡议遭拒后重启对华关系
item.description: 意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）承诺 "重启 "与中国的双边合作，这是她自去年拒绝中国的旗舰项目 "一带一路 "倡议以来首次正式访问北京。【原文：Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni pledged to “relaunch” bilateral cooperation with China as she kicked off her first official visit to Beijing since snubbing the country’s flagship Belt and Road Initiative last year.】

item.title: 肖尔茨未能推动德国经济腾飞
item.description: 德国无法实现有意义的增长，给经济的长期前景蒙上了阴影，也给奥拉夫-肖尔茨总理领导的三个执政党的政治希望蒙上了阴影。【原文：Germany’s inability to generate meaningful growth is casting a shadow over the long-term prospects for the economy — and political hopes for the three ruling parties under Chancellor Olaf Scholz.】

item.title: 英国财政大臣里夫斯详述 "破碎不堪 "的英国
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）将在周一的演讲中描绘英国公共财政的严峻形势，她将夹在反对党和自己党内的批评者之间。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will paint a dire picture of the UK’s public finances in a speech on Monday that will find her wedged between opposition parties and critics from within her own.】

item.title: 就业增长放缓，美联储即将点头同意降息
item.description: 美联储官员即将在数月内降低借贷成本，随着危及稳健但正在放缓的就业市场的风险不断增加，美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔可能会在下周发出这一信号。【原文：Federal Reserve officials are on the verge of lowering borrowing costs within months, a move Chair Jerome Powell may signal in the coming week as the risks grow of imperiling a solid but moderating job market.】

item.title: 美国办公楼贷款的痛苦才刚刚开始加剧
item.description: 本周，任何关于借贷成本下降将减轻美国办公室下滑带来的痛苦的希望都破灭了。【原文：Any hopes that falling borrowing costs would stem the pain from the US office downturn were swept away this week.】

item.title: Cantor Fitzgerald 将启动比特币融资计划
item.description: Cantor Fitzgerald LP 计划推出比特币融资业务，为拥有加密货币的投资者提供杠杆，从而加深这家投资银行与数字资产领域日益紧密的联系。【原文：Cantor Fitzgerald LP plans to launch a Bitcoin financing business to provide leverage to investors who own the cryptocurrency, deepening the investment bank’s growing ties to the digital assets sector.】

item.title: 美联储高利率的一年如何影响美国经济
item.description:
央行一整年都将借贷成本维持在二十多年来的高位。结果有些出人意料。【原文：

The central bank has kept borrowing costs at a more than two-decade high for a full year. The results have been somewhat surprising.

】

item.title: 人工智能和消费力存疑，财报令股价反弹受阻
item.description: 最新的财报加剧了美国股市的两大担忧：一是对人工智能的欣喜若狂已经过头，二是消费者的消费将在某一时刻开始停滞。【原文：The latest earnings reports are fanning two worries that were already gnawing away at the US stock market: That the euphoria about artificial intelligence had run too far and that — at some point — consumers spending will start to stall.】

item.title: 德国的法律骗子阻碍了欧洲对普京的回应
item.description: 长期以来，欧洲各国推动联合借贷以资助共同项目的努力一直受到德国的反对。【原文：European nations pushing for joint borrowing to fund shared projects have long been stymied by German opposition.】

item.title: 中国为推进制造业辩护，称世界需要更多电动汽车
item.description: 中国财政部副部长廖岷表示，中国的制造能力正在帮助世界应对气候变化和遏制通货膨胀，并反击了美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）对中国工业过剩的最新批评。【原文：China’s manufacturing capacity is helping the world fight climate change and contain inflation, said Vice Finance Minister Liao Min, pushing back against US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen’s latest criticism of the nation’s industrial excess.】

item.title: 瑞士央行行长乔丹在职业生涯回顾中说，"无聊 "总比错误好
item.description: 即将离任的瑞士国家银行行长托马斯-乔丹（Thomas Jordan）表示，如果某些人认为他领导瑞士国家银行的 12 年是枯燥乏味的，他并不在意，他说他总是做对国家有利的事。【原文：Outgoing Swiss National Bank President Thomas Jordan doesn’t have a problem if his 12 years leading the institution are viewed as dull in some quarters, saying he always did what was right for the country.】

item.title: 中国工业利润攀升，显示制造业实力增强
item.description: 6 月份，中国工业企业利润增速加快，显示出制造业的韧性，这有助于缓解经济放缓。【原文：Profits at Chinese industrial firms grew at a faster pace in June, showing the resilience of the manufacturing sector which has helped cushion an economic slowdown.】

item.title: 全球滞后的泰国股票让投资者将资金转向地区竞争对手
item.description: 多年来，泰国股票一直是东南亚最大的股票市场之一。这一牛市故事正在迅速瓦解，甚至连低廉的估值也无法挽救。【原文：For years, Thai equities stood tall as one of Southeast Asia’s largest stock markets. That bullish story is fast unraveling, and not even cheap valuations can save the day.】
